intro: Stellilabium tanii, commonly known as the Hawaiian star-labium, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant has lanceolate leaves that are opposite in arrangement and are often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Stellilabium tanii thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is a subject of conservation efforts.
